name: open-interest-history
description: Retrieves historical open interest data from Binance perpetual futures. Open interest represents the total number of outstanding derivative contracts that have not been settled. Output includes: timestamp, open interest value, and open interest USD value. This metric is crucial for understanding market liquidity, potential trend reversals, and the strength of price movements. Rising open interest with rising price suggests an uptrend with new money entering the market.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Time aggregation interval for open interest data

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of data points to retrieve (max 500)

parameters.name: endTime
parameters.description: End time in milliseconds since epoch (defaults to current time if not specified)
